intro: Hieracium isthmicola, commonly known as the Isthmus hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellowish to reddish composite flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has basal leaves that are usually hairy and lance-shaped. Hieracium isthmicola is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils.
